Based on your preferences, here are some recommendations:
1. "The Odyssey" - This epic poem by Homer follows Odysseus as he navigates through various obstacles and enemies in order to return home safely.
2. "The English Patient" - This drama film directed by James Ivory tells the story of a young nurse named Hana who cares for a badly burned plane crash victim named John. As they care for each other, they also begin to explore their own past and the memories that have shaped them into the people they are today.
3. "Lord Jim" - This novel written by Jules Verne tells the story of an 19th century seaman named Jim who lives for only one purpose: to redeem himself. As he travels through various obstacles and enemies in order to return home safely, he also begins to explore his own past and the memories that have shaped him into the person he is today.
4. "Teddy Scares" - This film written by Andrew Huggins tells the story of Cyrus who annoys all his companions with his new friend Toasty the toaster, so they decide to get rid of it.

I hope these recommendations are helpful and enjoyable for you!
